text: hi I'm Elise Brown and welcome to my
cupcake addiction
we're on today's episode I'm going to be
showing you how to make these gorgeous
frozen cupcakes these are frozen
inspired on the inside and on the
outside and they come with free
printable cupcake wrappers let's get
started to recreate your frozen cupcakes
you're going to need some frosting I'm
using our perfectly pipeable buttercream
frosting in white and also in blue and
I've got that in a disposable piping bag
paired with just an open star piping tip
today I'll link to our recipe in the
description box below I'm also using a
snowflake plunge cutter today so you can
use a regular cookie cutter but these
plunge cutters are great adding in just
a little bit of extra detail I've got
some food color in blue and also a color
called bright white a couple of spoons
some baking paper I'm using some silver
sanding sugar here today I've also got
some white fondant I've got a rolling
pin a knife add a little bit of
cornflour off to the side I've got a
cupcake tray I've also got some cupcake
liners and just a straight vanilla cake
mix you can use your favorite recipe or
you can use a packet mix so you want to
take your vanilla cake mix now and
spread it into three bowls or even
amount in each Bowl and I'm adding some
of that bright white into my first bowl
because I'm using a yellow cake here I
kind of want it to be not so yellow so
I'm adding that food coloring or you
could just use a white cake mix into the
second Bowl I'm just going to put one or
two drops of that blue color to make a
really nice light blue and then into the
third bowl I'm going to add quite a bit
of that blue food coloring at least
three or four drops to make a nice dark
blue stir that through until you've got
all three of your colors you should have
a white a light blue and a dark blue and
then you want to grab your cupcake tray
and all of your cupcake liners starting
with that dark blue I'm just spooning
about a tablespoon into the base of each
of my cupcake cases so they've all got a
dark blue bottom then you want to repeat
that process by putting a light blue
layer on top and then your third color
on the very top should be a white layer
don't overfill
take cases here you only want them to go
to about two-thirds of the way up the
cupcake case and it can be tempting to
put a bit too much batter in when you're
working with this many different colors
pop those off into a moderate oven as
per your manufacturer's instructions and
cook them until they spring back when
touched in the middle to make your
snowflakes you need that white fondant I
always use a little bit of Thai loads of
CMC which is a powder substance that you
add to fondant to help it set quite
quickly if you've got this you'll need
to make these about 12 hours in advance
and if you don't you need to give them
about 48 hours to fully set press in
your snowflake cutter and kind of jiggle
it around a little bit so that you
separate it from that other fondant and
then you just want to pull lunge the
cutter down and as you pull that shape
out you're going to see that you've
plunged in a really nice pattern and
you've got a really nice detailed
snowflake when your cupcakes come out of
the oven you want to let them completely
cool before we start decorating them and
when you cut those open you should end
up with all individually unique slightly
different ombre layered cupcakes so your
two different blues and your white in
there to frost those up you want to take
some of that white buttercream frosting
and I'm just using it back on my knife
just just sort of squish the frosting on
in a little bit of a dome this doesn't
have to be particularly neat and then
you want to roll just the edge so just
the outside sort of centimetre around
the edges of your cupcake in that silver
sanding sugar that's just going to add a
little bit of sparkle and a little bit
of glitter just like freshly fallen snow
take your piping bag now and I'm just
going to pipe just a spiral of that
frosting nice and neat but not too high
on top of that white and then you want
to take one of your preset snowflakes
and simply pop it on top when you're
renting out your cupcake wrappers I
recommend going with like a 210 GSM or a
slightly thicker cardstock rather than a
standard paper it just helps to give
them a bit more stability all you need
to do is print your wrappers cut them
out and a fix them at the back with a
little bit of sticky tape before popping
your cupcake in there you've got your
gorgeous frozen inspired on the inside
and the outside cupcakes ready to go for
your next frozen party make sure that
you check out my channel my cupcake
addiction for lots more great ideas for
frozen parties and as always thanks very
much for watching
